publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1224# Ms Margo MacDonald: Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit-That the Parliament resolves never to convene in a building constructed, finished or fitted out with materials purchased from countries in which conditions of employment and regulations regarding child labour differ markedly from our own in advance of a favourable outcome from an ethical employment audit carried out for the Scottish Parliament.
S1M-1224# Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit (lodged on 27 September 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Alex Neil*

S1M-1224# Ms Margo MacDonald: Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit—That the Parliament resolves never to convene in a building constructed, finished or fitted out with materials purchased from countries in which conditions of employment and regulations regarding child labour differ markedly from our own in advance of a favourable outcome from an ethical employment audit carried out for the Scottish Parliament. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil
S1M-1224# Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit (lodged on 27 September 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1224# Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit (lodged on 27 September 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Donald Gorrie*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-1224# Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit (lodged on 27 September 2000) Shona Robison*
S1M-1224# Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit (lodged on 27 September 2000) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1224# Ms Margo MacDonald: Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit—That the Parliament resolves never to convene in a building constructed, finished or fitted out with materials purchased from countries in which conditions of employment and regulations regarding child labour differ markedly from our own in advance of a favourable outcome from an ethical employment audit carried out for the Scottish Parliament. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Ms Sandra White
S1M-1224# Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit (lodged on 27 September 2000) Robin Harper*

S1M-1224# Ms Margo MacDonald: Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit—That the Parliament resolves never to convene in a building constructed, finished or fitted out with materials purchased from countries in which conditions of employment and regulations regarding child labour differ markedly from our own in advance of a favourable outcome from an ethical employment audit carried out for the Scottish Parliament. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper
S1M-1224# Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit (lodged on 27 September 2000) Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-1224# Ms Margo MacDonald: Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit—That the Parliament resolves never to convene in a building constructed, finished or fitted out with materials purchased from countries in which conditions of employment and regulations regarding child labour differ markedly from our own in advance of a favourable outcome from an ethical employment audit carried out for the Scottish Parliament. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Mr Kenny MacAskill

S1M-1224# Ms Margo MacDonald: Holyrood Project Ethical Employment Audit—That the Parliament resolves never to convene in a building constructed, finished or fitted out with materials purchased from countries in which conditions of employment and regulations regarding child labour differ markedly from our own in advance of a favourable outcome from an ethical employment audit carried out for the Scottish Parliament. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Mr Kenny MacAskill

Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram
